intro: Gilia glabrata, commonly known as the plains gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Gilia glabrata is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability.
